bbc.title: UN risks 'imminent financial collapse', secretary general warns
bbc.description: António Guterres says the international body could run out of money by July due to members' unpaid fees.

bbc.title: Trump picks Kevin Warsh to lead the US Federal Reserve
bbc.description: The 55-year-old economist had been considered for Fed chair during Trump's first term.

bbc.title: Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty if convicted, judge rules
bbc.description: A judge dismisses two federal counts against the 27-year-old, but he still faces state murder charges.

bbc.title: Former CNN host Don Lemon arrested after anti-ICE protest at Minnesota church
bbc.description: Lemon says he was just doing his job as a journalist reporting on the protests at the church.

bbc.title: Civil rights investigation opened into Alex Pretti shooting
bbc.description: The deputy attorney general said it was a “standard investigation” after Pretti's fatal shooting in Minneapolis.

bbc.title: Mali lawmaker jailed in Ivory Coast for insulting president
bbc.description: Prosecutors say Mamadou Hawa Gassama described Alassane Ouattara as a "tyrant" and "an enemy of Mali".

bbc.title: Ukraine sees quieter night as Trump says Putin will not attack its cities
bbc.description: Russia said the US president requested a pause in strikes on Kyiv until 1 February, a move Trump said was prompted by the cold weather.

bbc.title: At least 170 killed in air strikes during Myanmar's widely criticised election, UN says
bbc.description: The UN said "credible sources" had counted more than 400 strikes in the same period.

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: Exxon and Chevron Lift Oil Output, Blunting Crude Price Drop
bloomberg.description: Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp. surpassed profit expectations as higher oil production helped offset the blow from lower crude prices.

bloomberg.title: AC Milan Owner Refinances Elliott Loan With New Funds
bloomberg.description: RedBird Capital Partners, the owner of AC Milan, struck a deal for new debt that will refinance a vendor loan provided by Elliott Management Corp.

bloomberg.title: New Holland Starts Fund for Traders Tired of Multistrats
bloomberg.description: New Holland Capital is preparing to start an investment platform to lure stock traders exhausted by what it sees as the high pressure and siloed culture of giant multistrategy hedge funds.

bloomberg.title: ICE Begins Buying ‘Mega’ Warehouse Detention Centers Across US
bloomberg.description: Plans for such centers and jails in nearly two dozen communities have sparked protests over suitability, proximity to homes and schools.

bloomberg.title: Jeffrey Epstein Weighed Buying Private Jet From Apollo’s Rowan
bloomberg.description: Late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein considered buying a private jet from Apollo Global Management Inc. co-founder Marc Rowan a decade ago, according to emails released Friday by the US Department of Jus

bloomberg.title: SEC Adani Fraud Case Gets Path to Advance in Brooklyn Court
bloomberg.description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission’s fraud case against Gautam Adani on Friday cleared a procedural hurdle that had for months stalled the lawsuit against the Indian billionaire.

bloomberg.title: UN Says It Could Have Zero Cash by July as US Withholds Dues
bloomberg.description: The United Nations could run out of cash by July, its chief warned, as the organization continues to tackle a financial crisis largely fueled by overdue US payments.

aljazeera.title: What’s next for Venezuela?
aljazeera.description: We explore what's in store for Venezuela after the capture of President Maduro by US personnel in Caracas.

aljazeera.title: Rafah reopening set for Sunday as Israel continues to block aid
aljazeera.description: Israel says it will reopen the Rafah crossing on Sunday after nearly two years.

aljazeera.title: ISIL claims responsibility for Niger airport attack
aljazeera.description: Claim comes after military ruler Abdourahamane Tiani accused France, Benin, Ivory coast of involvement in the attack.

aljazeera.title: Confusion grows over state of US-Iran negotiations
aljazeera.description: The US and Iran both say they want a diplomatic solution to their standoff and regional players are increasingly active.

aljazeera.title: Guterres warns UN faces ‘imminent financial collapse’
aljazeera.description: UN chief Antonio Guterres calls on member states to address unpaid dues and overhaul world body's financial rules.

aljazeera.title: US Department of Justice releases 3 million new Epstein documents
aljazeera.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche says Friday's release fulfills a requirement established by congressional law.

aljazeera.title: Bombardier stock dives on Trump threats of 50% tariff on Canadian planes
aljazeera.description: Trump threatened decertifying Bombardier's planes and slapping new tariffs if Canada did not certify rival US planes.

aljazeera.title: US judge rules Luigi Mangione won’t face death penalty in CEO killing case
aljazeera.description: Judge rules out capital punishment, but 27-year-old still faces federal stalking charges and state-level murder charges.

washpost.title: Trump says he’s reopening Venezuelan airspace and Americans may visit
washpost.description: Venezuelan officials welcomed the announcement, which followed the U.S. capture this month of their president, Nicolás Maduro.

washpost.title: Trump says U.S. will decertify Canadian-made planes, threatens 50% tariff
washpost.description: The president accused Canada of blocking the sale of U.S.-made Gulfstream aircraft and said he would raise tariffs in the latest dispute to rock the once-chummy relationship.

washpost.title: Belarusian balloons full of cigarettes pose NATO’s latest security threat

washpost.description: The snow piles clogging up the capital’s streets would seem quaint in some cities — including ones prone to far greater quantities of snow.

washpost.title: Trump tightens screws on Cuba, threatening tariffs on oil suppliers
washpost.description: A new executive order declares that Havana constitutes a “national emergency,” allowing Trump to levy tariffs on any country that delivers oil to Cuba.

washpost.title: Russia reveals Ukraine energy ceasefire pushed by Trump is nearly over
washpost.description: Trump asked Putin to hold off hitting power facilities in Kyiv and other towns, but the Kremlin says the pause on strikes expires Sunday.

washpost.title: At India’s main energy summit, signs of a new world order without Trump
washpost.description: In the beachside state of Goa, officials and oil executives envisioned new energy pacts and multilateral relationships as a counterbalance to Trump’s America.

washpost.title: A U.S. letter opposed Iraqis’ choice of prime minister. They went ahead anyway.
washpost.description: The Trump administration sent a private letter opposing the choice of Nouri al-Maliki, the leading candidate for prime minister, considered close to Iran.
